Roman provinces were divided into two classes. Those which had been long organized, which were tranquil and needed no military garrison, were administered by proconsule sent out annually by the Senate. Those which were turbulent, or which lay on an exposed

A province might at any time be transferred from one list to the other. Pontus and Bithynia had been senatorial provinces, but their administration had fallen into such disorder that Trajan found it necessary to take them over into his own hands, , and to send out an imperial legate with extraordinary powers, tn reorganize the government and restore order.
